result.evidence: Activity com.app.damnvulnerablebank.CurrencyRates <intent-filter> tag with <action android:name="android.intent.action.VIEW" /> and <data android:host="xe.com" android:scheme="http"/> which could open a WebView without proper URL validation.
result.description: The CurrencyRates activity can be opened via deep link, potentially loading malicious URLs into a WebView without validation. This could lead to XSS attacks or other malicious activities.
result.false_positive_analysis: Review the CurrencyRates activity's WebView implementation to ensure proper URL validation is performed. Consider implementing a Content Security Policy to limit JavaScript execution within the WebView and enhance overall security.

masvs_reference.description: Ensure that deep links are properly validated to prevent URL manipulation or execution of arbitrary actions via WebViews.

result.description: The 'Myprofile' activity is exported, which means it can be accessed by any application on the device. Without a permission, this activity can be accessed without restriction, leading to unauthorized access or denial of service.
result.false_positive_analysis: Based on the provided AndroidManifest.xml, 'Myprofile' activity has no protection from other apps accessing it. Without any permission, any other app can launch this activity on behalf of our app. Although it has no explicit intent-filter, an attacker could still use intent to launch this activity which could lead to unintended consequences, including loss of sensitive user data.
